tourist.title: Currency Guide for Tourists
tourist.historyDescription: Discover the fascinating history behind Morocco's unique currency system and why we have multiple currencies.

dirham.title: Moroccan Dirham (DH)
dirham.description: The modern official currency of Morocco, introduced in 1960 to replace the Moroccan franc.
dirham.fact1: Named after the Arabic word 'dirham' meaning 'drachma'
dirham.fact2: Replaced the Moroccan franc at a rate of 1 DH = 100 francs
dirham.fact3: Features King Mohammed VI and Moroccan landmarks on banknotes

ryal.title: Ryal (Real)
ryal.description: An ancient currency unit that predates the dirham, still used in traditional contexts.
ryal.fact1: Originally a Spanish silver coin from the 15th century
ryal.fact2: 1 ryal = 5 centimes (0.05 DH) in modern conversion
ryal.fact3: Still used in traditional markets and rural areas

franc.title: Moroccan Franc
franc.description: The predecessor to the dirham, used during the French protectorate period.
franc.fact1: Introduced during French colonial rule in 1912
franc.fact2: 1 franc = 1 centime = 0.01 DH in modern terms
franc.fact3: Replaced by the dirham in 1960 for national identity

centime.title: Centime
centime.description: The smallest unit of Moroccan currency, equivalent to 1/100th of a dirham.
centime.fact2: Used for small transactions and precise pricing
centime.fact3: Available as coins in 1, 5, 10, 20, and 50 centime denominations
